revised_title: Northampton Earthquake of 1749: A Detailed Account and Observations
tldr: In 1749, a mild earthquake was felt in Northampton, causing various reactions and effects on the town's inhabitants and structures. The author, P. Doddridge, provides a detailed account of the event, including the time, location, and intensity of the shock, as well as the reactions and observations of people in the town. The earthquake was felt more on the eastern side of the town, and its effects were reported in nearby areas as well. The author also mentions the weather conditions and barometric readings before and after the event.
